page.title: 08TRANSPORT AT TEVIOTHEAD
page.content: {THE CAR}IS ESSENTIAL FOR THE PEOPLE OF TEVIOTHEAD AS THE A7 EDINBURGH-CARLISLE ROAD IS THE ONLY MEANS OF ACCESS TO THE AREA. TWO MINOR ROADS LEAD OFF THIS BOTH OF WHICH FINISH IN DEAD-ENDS AT FARMS OR FORESTRY PLANTATIONS. THERE IS A{BUS {SERVICE}FROM CARLISLE-EDINBURGH RETURN SIX TIMES DAILY ON THE A7. THE OLDER SCHOOL CHILDREN ARE BUSSED TO SCHOOL IN HAWICK. THE BUS FARE TO HAWICK COSTS Â£1.90 RETURN BUT TRANSPORT TO SCHOOL IS FREE. PEOPLE MAKE JOURNEYS TO HAWICK AT LEAST WEEKLY FOR SHOPPING, PETROL AND THE BANK. TRACTORS ARE USED FOR TRANSPORTING LIVESTOCK AND EQUIPMENT ON THE FARMS. MOST FARMERS ALSO OWN 4-WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLES WHICH HELP TO OVERCOME THE PROBLEMS OF SNOW AND ICE DURING THE WINTER. THE COUNCIL CLEAR THE ROADS IN WINTER.
